adviseScripts.text: It's nice that there aren't many machines here at Snowfield.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I don't have to worry about my hands wreaking havoc on the place.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I'm actually a little bummed now that I have less work to do.
That's great.
Haha!
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I suppose I didn't factor your feelings into the equation.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I appreciate your desire to help me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I know, right?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: So, feel free to kick back and relax in the hot spring.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Ludmilla and I have a good time at the hot spring together.
I received information about a new hot spring.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: One that's not too far from here.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Servant.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Hand over a shovel.
Prepare to go out with the shovel in hand.
Surely you're not insinuating that I should have to do the digging myself?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: ... Sorry.
I will forgive you for this transgression.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Now, bring that shovel and follow me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Well done.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Bring that shovel, and follow me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I hope this is a big hot spring.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I proceeded to work hard at digging, all under Ludmilla's supervision.
It's good that we have so many guests at the hot spring now,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: but I'm worried that many of them don't know proper bathing etiquette.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Do you know the rules of which I speak, Servant?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: When entering the hot spring, you should cover your body with a towel.
Before entering the hot spring, you should wash your body.
Not necessarily.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Many TV shows depict people covering themselves with a towel before entering a bath,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: and so lots of people mistakenly feel they must do the same.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: In fact, entering with a towel on is considered impolite.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: What's shown on TV is just for show.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Next time, I hope you can display proper bathing etiquette while enjoying the hot spring.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: That's correct.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Entering the bath without washing beforehand could negatively affect other customers' experiences.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: If I were to see something dirty floating in the water...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I don't even want to imagine how I'd feel.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I discuss bathing etiquette with Ludmilla.
Servant, prepare the tea.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Today, I would like to drink tea that fits thematically with the hot spring.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Prepare green tea.
Prepare jasmine tea.
So you've made green tea.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Green tea after a bath might be bitter, but it is also quite smooth, and therefore is an excellent choice.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Well done, Servant.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: So you've made jasmine tea.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: While this is my favorite, I was in the mood for something else today.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: However, since you have already prepared it, I will drink it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I enjoy a cup of tea with Ludmilla.
Apparently, vacation resorts are sometimes frequented by rather rowdy groups.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: While I understand vacation can be exciting, I feel you should be mindful of others around you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: What do you think?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: None of us here are too loud, so it doesn't matter.
We should remind everyone of this beforehand so nothing like that happens.
Hahaha!
adviseScripts.speaker: Belorta

adviseScripts.text: Belorta! Wait for me!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mica

adviseScripts.text: That's right.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Isn't the true definition of a vacation
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: for everyone participating to feel good and have a good time?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Ludmilla and I have a conversation about the type of people you hate at vacation resorts.
I feel like we should have our session outside today, just for a change of pace.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Is there anywhere you'd like to go in particular?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: The forest next to the hot spring.
The waterfall next to the dormitory.
Forest, you say?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I can already smell the fresh night air.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Go and prepare the tea which we will drink in the forest.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Servant...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I've been wondering this for a while now,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: but do you have a particular fascination with potentially freezing to death?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I have a meaningful time with Ludmilla.
Lots of Christmas dishes pair wonderfully with tea.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Do you have a particular fondness for any?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Cake.
Turkey.
So you like cake as well?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: In my opinion, a slice of cake with a cup of tea is perfection.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: If you prepare the tea, I'll prepare the cake.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Turkey?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I can't say it's something that pairs particularly well with tea,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: but I will indulge you since it's your preference.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I spend time with Ludmilla while imagining various delicacies.
Ludmilla sits on a chair, gazing at the falling snow outside the window.
What should I do?
Watch from afar.
Sit beside her.
There's no need to keep your distance, Servant. Come sit down.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I realize that this snow is no different from what I usually see at the northern base,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: but it somehow feels different.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Less harsh. Do you feel it too?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Oh, hello, Servant.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: It's interesting.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I realize that this snow is no different from what I usually see at the northern base,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: but it somehow feels different.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Instead of feeling harsh and frigid, it actually feels comforting.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Maybe it has to do with how you feel about this place.
Yes.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: You might be right.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I have a heart-to-heart talk with Ludmilla.
There are many things about Snowfield that I feel are worth boasting about,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: but the breakfast menu is a particular point of pride for me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: How about it? Would you like to try our breakfast?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I only eat twice a day, so...
Of course. Can I have some now?
I see. That's a shame.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Let me know whenever you want to try it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Haha, I'm afraid it's a bit late for that now,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: but you can come to the restaurant in the morning tomorrow.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Just so you know,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: you'll have to cook it yourself.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I have a meaningful time with Ludmilla.
I left some pamphlets about the hot spring in front of the entrance to the dormitory.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: It wasn't easy collecting all the information to put inside.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Which sections did you find most interesting, Servant?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: The hot spring's history.
The effects of the hot spring.
May I ask why?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I found it fascinating how this place has been enjoyed by people who prioritized a quality lifestyle.
Haha, you really paid attention.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: That's my favorite section as well.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Personally, I think I'm very much in line with that tradition.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: But there were only two lines speaking about the effects of the water...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Servant... did you actually read the pamphlet?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I study the history of the hot springs with Ludmilla.
I heard that there were many ghost stories about traveling to the hot springs in the past.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Like people disappearing and the like.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Or a mysterious entity glancing at you from outside the window.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Do you have a fascination with these kinds of ghost stories?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I don't believe in ghost stories.
Wait... are those handprints I see outside the window?
Hmm... I see.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I can understand that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I wanted to share some stories with you but...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Too bad.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Nice try, Servant. Just because I brought up ghost stories
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: doesn't mean I'll fall for a silly old trick like that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: *Bang bang bang*
Hmm? Who's that knocking on the window?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: But... we're not on the first floor.
I have a cup of tea with Ludmilla to change the atmosphere.
Servant, what do you typically associate with a hot spring?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Relaxation.
You, Ludmilla.
A reasonable answer,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: considering how many come to the hot spring for rest.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Good answer, Servant.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: If I am the first thing you think about when you glance at the northern base,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: the snow and the hot spring, that makes me very happy indeed.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Ludmilla about hot springs.
Christmas isn't Christmas without gifts.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: What gift would you like, Servant?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Some fine tea.
You.
I didn't realize you liked tea enough to want it as a Christmas gift.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: If you're saying that just to appease me, you don't have to.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Just speak honestly.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Hahaha. That's bold of you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I take it that means you enjoy the time you spend with me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I'm happy.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Ludmilla about appropriate gifts.
Servant,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: did you feel that anything was lacking during your stay at Snowfield?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: There could have been a greater variety of dishes...
Nope. Nothing.
I see.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: While the quality of our food is exceptional, I suppose it does fall short in terms of variety.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I appreciate the constructive feedback.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Hmm.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Even though it's me, nothing is perfect.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I must say that I'm a bit disappointed. I thought you would be honest with me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Ludmilla about the difficulties of the service industry.
Servant, let me ask you something.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Do you prefer cooking or eating?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Cooking.
Eating.
I'm glad.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Cooking requires a lot of hands-on dedication.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I'll be sure to prepare some of your favorite dishes for you.
Haha, I'd like that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I look forward to the day that I can taste your cooking.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Hmm... is that so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: That's too bad. I was looking forward to your cooking.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Don't be too hard on yourself though; even if you're no good at cooking, you'll always be my one and only Servant.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Ludmilla and I watch a cooking show together.
What do you think about my new outfit,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Servant?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I prefer how you usually dress.
It's gorgeous.
Is that so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I know that what I usually wear suits me,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: but I think this looks quite good on me as well.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Haha, I think the same.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I usually save this outfit for Snowfield Hot Spring.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I'm a big fan of how this brings out my elegance.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Ludmilla and I have a conversation about how a queen should dress.
When things used to be peaceful on the surface,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I heard people went traveling a lot.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Servant.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: When you travel,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: do you prefer traveling alone,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: or with others?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I prefer traveling alone.
I prefer traveling with others.
Really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I respect your choice, of course,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: but since you tend to get lost quite often, I think it would be best if you travel with others.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Traveling is always better with other people.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: The joy you feel multiplies,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: and more importantly, there's a smaller possibility of running into danger.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I think you'll need a traveling companion.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Ludmilla about how to travel safely.
*Sigh* This is so hard.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I used to not understand what Liter was talking about when she spoke about her body aching,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: but I think I do now.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Running Snowfield Hot Spring is no easy task.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: You've got to stay strong.
Get some rest. I'll help you.
You're right.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I'm the owner of this place. It's my responsibility to see that it's run smoothly.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Thank you, Servant. Your encouragement gave me a second wind.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: No.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: You may be my servant, but this is my responsibility.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I'll accept your thoughts and opinions, but nothing more.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Ludmilla about the difficulties of running things as an owner.
Decorating Snowfield Hot Spring was much more enjoyable than I thought it would be.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I now understand why Mighty Tools makes this their life's work.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Have you ever considered joining Mighty Tools?
I still think being a queen suits you best.
Hmm...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: If I were to transfer to Mighty Tools...
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Just imagine all the electronics that would be destroyed in one month.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I think there are other things that I should be doing.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I also think the same.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I performed admirably in terms of decorating Snowfield this time around, but it was incredibly frustrating being unable to utilize any electric tools.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: It seems to me that the northern base suits me best.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Ludmilla and I have a conversation about DIY tasks.
Christmas is a special day.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Some spend it busying themselves with activities,
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: while others use it to rest.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: How do you usually spend Christmas?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I often go out to Royal Road.
I usually rest in the Commander's Room.
Oh.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I thought for sure you'd say something like relaxing in the Commander's Room.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Then again, rest is all well and good again, but it's also good to go out, since there are so many special things to see and do on Christmas.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Hahaha.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: You're starting to sound like an honest-to-goodness workaholic.
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: Is Andersen rubbing off on you?
adviseScripts.speaker: Ludmilla

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Ludmilla about Christmas.
